016package de.cuioss.test.jsf.producer;
017
018import java.util.Map;
019
020import javax.enterprise.context.ApplicationScoped;
021import javax.enterprise.context.RequestScoped;
022import javax.enterprise.inject.Produces;
023import javax.faces.annotation.ApplicationMap;
024import javax.faces.annotation.HeaderMap;
025import javax.faces.annotation.HeaderValuesMap;
026import javax.faces.annotation.InitParameterMap;
027import javax.faces.annotation.RequestCookieMap;
028import javax.faces.annotation.RequestParameterMap;
029import javax.faces.annotation.SessionMap;
030import javax.faces.annotation.ViewMap;
031import javax.faces.application.Application;
032import javax.faces.component.UIViewRoot;
033import javax.faces.context.ExternalContext;
034import javax.faces.context.FacesContext;
035import javax.inject.Named;
036
037/**
038 * Various JSF Producers for junit tests.
039 *
040 * Reason: In the test context we don't have a JSF implementation, which would
041 * provide equivalent producers.
042 *
043 * It is designed as 'opt-in'. Use with {@code @AddBeanClasses}.
044 *
045 * @author Oliver Wolff
046 */
047@ApplicationScoped
048public class JsfObjectsProducer {
049
050    @Produces
051    @RequestScoped
052    @Named
053    FacesContext getFacesContext() {
054        return FacesContext.getCurrentInstance();
055    }
056
057    @Produces
058    @RequestScoped
059    @Named
060    ExternalContext getExternalContext() {
061        return getFacesContext().getExternalContext();
062    }
063
064    @Produces
065    @ApplicationScoped
066    Application produceApplication() {
067        return FacesContext.getCurrentInstance().getApplication();
068    }
069
070    @Produces
071    @RequestScoped
072    @Named
073    Object getRequest() {
074        return getExternalContext().getRequest();
075    }
076
077    @Produces
078    @RequestScoped
079    @SessionMap
080    @Named("sessionScope")
081    Map<String, Object> getSessionMap() {
082        return getExternalContext().getSessionMap();
083    }
084
085    @Produces
086    @RequestScoped
087    @RequestParameterMap
088    @Named("param")
089    Map<String, String> getRequestParameterMap() {
090        return getExternalContext().getRequestParameterMap();
091    }
092
093    @Produces
094    @RequestScoped
095    @Named("view")
096    UIViewRoot getViewRoot() {
097        return getFacesContext().getViewRoot();
098    }
099
100    @Produces
101    @RequestScoped
102    @ViewMap
103    @Named("viewScope")
104    Map<String, Object> getViewMap() {
105        return getFacesContext().getViewRoot().getViewMap();
106    }
107
108    @Produces
109    @RequestScoped
110    @HeaderMap
111    @Named("header")
112    Map<String, String> getHeaderMap() {
113        return getExternalContext().getRequestHeaderMap();
114    }
115
116    @Produces
117    @RequestScoped
118    @HeaderValuesMap
119    @Named("headerValues")
120    Map<String, String[]> getHeaderValuesMap() {
121        return getExternalContext().getRequestHeaderValuesMap();
122    }
123
124    @Produces
125    @RequestScoped
126    @InitParameterMap
127    @Named("initParam")
128    Map<String, String> getInitParameter() {
129        return getExternalContext().getInitParameterMap();
130    }
131
132    @Produces
133    @ApplicationScoped
134    @ApplicationMap
135    @Named("applicationScope")
136    Map<String, Object> getApplicationMap() {
137        return getExternalContext().getApplicationMap();
138    }
139
140    @Produces
141    @RequestScoped
142    @RequestCookieMap
143    @Named("cookie")
144    Map<String, Object> getRequestCookieMap() {
145        return FacesContext.getCurrentInstance().getExternalContext().getRequestCookieMap();
146    }
147}
